ARTICLE.TITLE: Szijjártó Calls for Dialogue in Conflict Between Greece, Turkey, Cyprus
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó on Friday called for dialogue in solving rising tensions between Greece, Turkey and Cyprus over the rights to search for energy resources in the eastern Mediterranean.

“I hope common sense will prevail, and dialogue will lead to a solution rather than mutual threats and sanctions,” Szijjártó said on Facebook.

The minister said he had talked to his Turkish and Cypriot counterparts, Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu and Nikos Christodoulides, and said he hoped they would soon reach an agreement.

Featured image by Mátyás Borsos/KKM/MTI
